definition: lit. to slap the table (in amazement, praise, anger, resentment etc)/fig. astonishing!, wonderful!, dreadful! etc
to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)
(legal) case/incident/record/file/table
lit. slap the table and shout with praise (idiom); fig. wonderful!/amazing!/great!
lit. to slap the table and stand up (idiom); fig. at the end of one's tether/unable to take it any more
to slap the table in amazement (idiom); wonderful!/amazing!
Slapping the Table in Amazement (Part II), second of two books of vernacular stories by Ming dynasty novelist Ling Mengchu 凌濛初|凌蒙初[Ling2 Meng2 chu1]
pinyin: Er4 ke4 Pai1 an4 Jing1 qi2

definition: Slapping the Table in Amazement (Part I), first of two books of vernacular stories by Ming dynasty novelist Ling Mengchu 凌濛初|凌蒙初[Ling2 Meng2 chu1]
pinyin: Chu1 ke4 Pai1 an4 Jing1 qi2

sentences.english: His skill level was simply astounding .
sentences.chinese: 他的技術水平令人拍案叫絕。

sentences.english: It may have been my greatest "Wow! "moment in all of sports.
sentences.chinese: 那是我一切體育觀看經歷當中，最爲拍案叫絕的時刻。

sentences.english: Amazingly enough, your phone rings in area 215.
sentences.chinese: 拍案叫絕不夠，你的電話鈴聲面積215。

sentences.english: The judge was enraged and stroke the table for several times.
sentences.chinese: 大法官被氣得連連拍案。

sentences.english: Their set designs are always stunning.
sentences.chinese: 他們的佈景設計經常讓人拍案叫絕。

sentences.english: "Hoisting ring's king" rookie player Chen Yibing has demonstrated brilliant performance which made me clap the table.
sentences.chinese: “吊環王”小將陳一冰的精彩表現令我拍案叫絕。

sentences.english: They will tell you many things which you have never known and whereat you will be amazed.
sentences.chinese: 他們會告訴你許多你聞所未聞，使你拍案稱奇的事情。

sentences.english: Of course, made me this lovely is published.
sentences.chinese: 當然，更讓我拍案叫絕的是出版這件事。

sentences.english: Yang ling on the spot the rage.
We were overwhelmed with admiration for the superb performance.
sentences.chinese: 精彩的表演令人拍案叫絕。

definition: lit. to slap the table and stand up (idiom); fig. at the end of one's tether/unable to take it any more
to clap hands
stamp (one's feet)
to suddenly change color showing displeasure, bewilderment etc
how can this be so? (idiom); preposterous/ridiculous/absurd
glare/angry look/to open one's eyes wide/to stare angrily/to glare/to glower
to stare
angry/indignant
loudly/in a loud voice
stern voice
face light up with delight (idiom); to beam with joy
unable to restrain one's anger (idiom); in a towering rage
angry/enraged/Taiwan pr. [fei4 ran2]
to split one's sides laughing
enlightening remarks (honorific)/brilliant views
stamp with fury/fly into a rage
